questions.question: If the axial load on a footing increase, what is the most effective way to maintain structural safety?

answers.c: Reduce the grade of concrete used
answers.d: Ignore the change as concrete has high compressive strength

questions.question: What happens if the soil bearing capacity is lower than expected?

answers.a: The footing size should be increased
answers.c: The column size should be reduced

questions.question: How does an eccentric axial load affect the footing design?

answers.c: Has no impact on footing size

questions.question: Which failure mode is most critical in an RC isolated footing under high axial load?
If the depth of the footing is increased significantly, which of the following statements is true?

answers.a: Bending moment decreases, but punching shear increases
answers.b: Both bending moment and shear force increase
answers.d: There is no impact on structural performance
